reviews.text: This hotel is a standard courtyard offering. Standard clean rooms and friendly service. The location is great, within a walking distance to Soho attractions and stores. Good restaurants nearby that concierge can help you with. A reasonable cab ride from Pennsylvania Station.
reviews.title: Cost effective shoice in Soho

reviews.text: Had a great stay and appreciated the managers accomodating our request or a high floor!
reviews.title: It's practically perfect in every way.

reviews.text: Walking disance to the village and all the cool restaurants,brownstone buildings and shops.
reviews.title: Great stay in Soho

reviews.text: You will not regret staying at this Courtyard,rest assured.
reviews.title: Great Hotel in Lower Manhattan

reviews.text: I came to NYC for US Open and to visit friends. Decided to stay at the Courtyard since i was able to get a very good rate and i enjoy staying in Soho. From the moment i arrived, I was greeted by Lewis at the front desk and he was very friendly and professional. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. It was small but that's the normal for NYC hotels. The #1 was right outside the hotel and its a quick commute into midtown. I would definitely recommend the hotel to anyone that is looking to stay in the Soho area.
reviews.title: Very Pleasant Stay...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Man oh man, luckily I could reach the top of the closet...had to store everything up there. The room was very clean; the bathroom was adequate. the TV was nice. It was just too small. I know this sounds like an exaggeration, but if both of us were in the room, one of us needed to be in the bed (unless the other person was in the bathroom). I also picked this location because of it's proximity to Greenwich Village. It is true that Greenwich Village is about six or seven blocks away. However, the hotel is also on the "final glidepath" to the Holland tunnel. What this means is if the traffic is backed up in the Holland tunnel, it can take you 45 minutes to travel the last three blocks to your hotel. It also presents a problem when trying to check out. Overall, I would rate this as a fairly serious problem (I parked four blocks away. The morning we left it took me almost an hour to go around the block because of the Holland tunnel traffic).
reviews.title: Rooms are SMALL; Consider other options.

reviews.text: Also, getting ice is a total drag. You have to use your key to make the elevator move. You also have to switch elevators in the lobby and take a separate one to the basement. As if that were not bad enough, the ice bucket they give you is probably 20 ounce capacity. Honestly, it is so small, that you almost laugh when you pick it up. Really, I have never seen anything like it. It is just a joke. And the glasses were also very small. Now that I think about it, it is almost like they were afraid to pick normal size tools or implements for fear of making the room look as tiny as it was.
reviews.title: Very Nice and Contemporary

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The one thing that I really liked about this room is that you could open the window. You know how it is: you're in a small room high up in the sky with an obstructed view. It's nice to be able to open the window a few inches and get some fresh air and hear some city noises. Somehow it makes it seem less claustrophobic. also, to be fair, the bed was comfortable. Internet was free. However, these positives were probably not enough to make me want to stay here again. Let's put it this way: I would examine a lot of other options before I selected this hotel (oh and did I mention that parking is $65 per day?)
reviews.title: A good base for Soho

reviews.text: Something that happened really wasn't the fault of the staff. However, they clearly did not fret very much about it. For some reason, probably alcohol induced, several women in a neighboring room chose to go out in the hallway at 2 AM and have a "cat fight." I am sure this woke everybody on the floor up. The problem is the hotel staff took 10 or 15 minutes to get up to the floor. By that time the fight had fizzled out and the girls had returned to the room. No apology was offered by the management. When we made an inquiry the next morning we got this response "what… Oh yeah, I heard something about that... sorry."
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: While this was not a hotel horror story, I was semi-desperate when I booked this room. I probably would have to be semi-desperate to stay here again.
reviews.title: Comfort and convenience in Soho

reviews.text: Checking into the Courtyard by Marriott hotel in Varick Street, SoHo was very efficient and pleasant; the staff were courteous and friendly throughout my stay.
reviews.title: A Surprisingly Nice Part of Town

reviews.text: I was on the 4th floor of this 19 story tall, but small hotel in Varick Street, SoHo. Before arriving here and checking out the area I was not looking forward to my stay. I usually stay in Mid-Town near to Grand Central Terminal but tho is where I was booked by my client.
reviews.title: Central location for a NYC stay
Serves it's purpose
reviews.text: It was really convenient for work as the walk was literally less than 2 minutes.
As the days passed by, I really appreciated being in this part of new York, I really had a good time and had my eyes opened to new and nice things - I'd definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel for Exploring Lower Manhattan/SoHo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A short walk in any direction took me to really nice areas for food, shopping or just taking-in New York. It's handy for the Holland tunnel and travel to Newark Airport.
reviews.title: A good second option

reviews.text: Staff was extremely helpful, they held our bags and allowed us into our room early as well. Close to the subway, close to everything in downtown Manhattan. It was a bit snug, especially with a family. But, we were only there a short time and after all, a NYC room will always be smaller than a room somewhere else.
reviews.title: A bit spartan, but well located, clean and well run

reviews.text: Ill be honest we stayed 3 nights for 200 aud a night as that was the deal, the 4th become 330 so we stayed the next 4 elsewhere. However my wide and I would've been happy to stay here the entire 7 days. What more do you want, great location in the west, no unnecessary waiting round at check in, nice gym, clean spacious rooms. Seriously for the right price it's a winner. The lobby is huge, smart, cafe Starbucks, a NYC feel that most ppl want... Walking distance to the Hudson river and bleaker st and main soho shopping district. Trust me on this one.
reviews.title: Perfect without the expectations
Can't understand why people rave about this place
reviews.text: I had a business trip to New York recently and this place was suggested by my travel agent because it was near my office. Although it was more expensive than others I looked at, based on the reviews here I was quite happy - but I'm afraid it didn't live up to expectations.

reviews.title: Good hotel, great location
reviews.text: The rooms, even by New York standards, are tiny. Front office reception was surly, zero smiles, zero effort. The location is not somewhere I'd particularly want to be unless I happened to be round the corner from work.

Worst, I was substantially overcharged on departure. I was rushing to catch a cab to the airport (they'd hurridly handed me the bill charged to my card as I walked out) when I happened to notice that I'd been charged an extra night. When I went back in to query another manager had to come and sort it out.
reviews.title: A Practical Hotel, but not much fun
